value.title: AI is now a C-suite imperative
value.excerpt: Machines can work at infinitely higher speed and the pressure on the C-suite has never been higher. Now the execs are turning to AI to help them make the best decisions in as short a time as possible.

value.title: AI Ethics ‘Tuning Knobs’ A Questionable Mesh, Including For Self-Driving Cars

value.title: DeepMind sets AI loose on Diplomacy board game, and collaboration is key

value.title: Use AI responsibly to uplift historically disenfranchised people during COVID-19

value.title: Company boards aren't ready for the AI revolution

value.title: AI Is Amazing But Complicated, And We Don’t Necessarily Need To Plunge In Headfirst
value.excerpt: We know AI has biases. We know it’s complex. We understand that AI may or may not draw fair and ethical conclusions all the time. Yet it’s clear that AI is going to happen anyway. Physicist Stephen Hawking said AI was a major concern.

value.title: War machines: DOD's ethical principles for battlefield AI
value.excerpt: Earlier this year, the Department of Defense announced the adoption of its ethical principles for Artificial Intelligence. ZDNet has been tracking this process since it gained momentum, but DoD's official adoption of the principles was overshadowed in the general media when COVID hit the US.

images.title: War machines: DOD's ethical principles for battlefield AI

value.title: VB Transform 2020: Women in AI to kick off the digital AI conference of the year
value.excerpt: Bias in AI models and algorithms is among the biggest challenges in applied AI. Women leaders and practitioners have been leading the charge in tackling those blind spots. They’re at the forefront in thinking about how the ethics of applied AI, and how it can center empathy, fairness, and human centricity to create truly balanced models and ...

value.title: Uber researchers investigate whether AI can behave ethically

value.title: Ethical AI and the importance of guidelines for algorithms — explained
value.excerpt: Amazon had to discontinue an artificial intelligence–powered recruiting tool after it discovered the system was biased against female applicants. In 2016, a ProPublica investigation revealed a recidivism assessment tool that used machine learning was biased against black defendants.

images.title: Ethical AI and the importance of guidelines for algorithms — explained

value.title: Asia Pacific emerging as global AI epicentre, says analyst
value.excerpt: Supportive government framework and policies are expected to enable the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region to emerge as the global epicentre for the growth of artificial intelligence (AI), according to one global analytics firm.

value.title: Human fighter pilots set to take on AI drones in aerial dogfights in 2021
value.excerpt: The first aerial showdown between a human fighter pilot and an autonomous aircraft is slated for July 2021, according to a fascinating interview with the outgoing Director of the US Department of Defense's Joint Artificial Intelligence Center (JAIC).
